intro: Turpinia doanii, commonly known as the Doan's turpentine tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Oleaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
